markdown:
<title level="1" right="Focus 6" pfs="">[Ash Form](/Spells.aspx?ID=1241)</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Blood Lords</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cursebound" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=320" />
<trait label="Oracle" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=319" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #185: A Taste of Ashes](/Sources.aspx?ID=188) pg. 81</row>

**Mystery**
[Ash](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=10)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Two Actions" /></row>
<row>[verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You take the form of a cloud of minuscule ash particles. You gain [fast healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=15) 3, resistance 10 to piercing and slashing damage, and immunity to bleed, [falling damage](/Rules.aspx?ID=402), and precision damage. You can't move through solid objects, but you can stream through tiny gaps as if they were difficult terrain. Any ability with the [air](/Traits.aspx?ID=5) trait that involves blowing or shifting wind (such as [_gust of wind_](/Spells.aspx?ID=143)) deals you 1d6 bludgeoning damage per level of the spell each round you are in its area, in addition to its normal effects.

---
**Heightened (9th)** The resistance increases to 15.
name: Ash Form
